channel.title: Make a Server help
channel.description:
1. if i type my gateway in the adress bar than speedtouch comes up. can i do it whith speedtouch too ? 2. do you need a client first or after? 3. and in the guide stands that you need "compile" but i dont have "compile".
pls help me whith these qeustions. ty ;D
p.s sorry for my broken english :P

item.title: Make a Server help
item.dc:creator: @nkmol nkmol
item.description:
@nkmol wrote:

the compiler didnt work

can some just give me a client that i can edit?
en maybe a tut how edit a client?
sorry, but i angry because nobody give some anwser on my qeustoins
i starte this topic on December 18!
lol?

Read full topic

item.title: Make a Server help
item.dc:creator: @help_wit_server help wit server
item.description:
@help_wit_server wrote:

@echo off
title compile
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

try that compiler for a while it should work perfectly

Read full topic

item.title: Make a Server help
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“nkmol, post:14, topic:251164”][quote author=si force link=topic=331432.msg2588489#msg2588489 date=1229636819]
127.0.0.1 is your own Localhost IP, Your the only person who can use it at the moment,
And you can also use any client as long as you use Either ‘127.0.0.1’ or ‘Localhost’,

You can also use your own IP if you know how to get a server up and running.
[/quote]
so they IP is online?
and i cant add items because i need class8 and i dont have a client so i dont have class8! :o[/quote]

The IP’s ‘127.0.0.1’ and ‘Localhost’ are Online if your computer is usually, And you need Client files for a class8, Not server.

Read full topic

item.title: Make a Server help
item.dc:creator: @dboy28 dboy28
item.description:
@dboy28 wrote:

[quote=“nkmol, post:9, topic:251164”][quote author=dboy28 link=topic=331432.msg2588128#msg2588128 date=1229626044]

  1. if i type my gateway in the adress bar than speedtouch comes up.
    can i do it whith speedtouch too ?
  2. do you need a client first or after?
  3. and in the guide stands that you need “compile” but i dont have “compile”.
    pls help me whith these qeustions.
    ty ;D

p.s sorry for my broken english

Okay well i dont understand your question much, but with Speedtouch, im guessing your in Hull?
well i own a server and im in hull, so thats possable

You need to either download Moparscape w/ Aryan (At the top)
Or play Online at www.moparisthebest.com
Either Way, you must leave u IP blank to connect to your own server

Compiler’s i dont have a clue about, sorry.
[/quote]
what do you mean whith: “IP blank”?[/quote]

When you try logging onto a server, you change the IP Adress to the server, When you want to connect to your own server, what ur running on ur pc, you delete EVERYTHING in that Slot( IP Adress) to connect, Well i do anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Make a Server help
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“nkmol, post:7, topic:251164”][quote author=si force link=topic=331432.msg2587965#msg2587965 date=1229619675]

Then download one, Or get a soure with one.

Download a BAT file, why not just make one?

@echo off
javac *.java
pause

Simple.

I suppose that makes a bit more sense, To make it You add that Code snippet to
A ‘New Text File’, Then you do save as, Change the file type to any and add the name ‘Compiler.bat’ .
[/quote]
if i do that there comes a error
javec do not become recognises as a nternal or external task, program and batchresistant[/quote]

Here, Do this.

[quote=“iMONSTAR, post:1, topic:78102”]Ok before we can fix the compiler and google, we need to set out variables. Ok go into start menu, then control panel, then system, then advanced, then enviromental variables.

start menu -> control panel -> system -> advanced -> enviromental variables

Ok now find the variable called “path” in the list in that new screen open. Rename it to “PATH” and then for it’s variable value (erase old one):
C:Windows\System32;“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin”

You will also need to set a variables called “classpath”. Make a new variable and give it the name classpath. No add this in for it’s value:
“C:\Program Files\Java\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin”

2-2.jpg418×553
1-3.jpg419×552
[/quote]

Remember to replace

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\
With the path to your JDK bin folder.
JDK Update 11: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\

JDK Update 10:
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin</blockquote>

Read full topic
